15:04 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
15:22 <cjd> hi guys, I'm looking for a name for the realtime collaborative editor algorithm which I'll be moving into contrib soon...  
15:23 <cjd> It's based on the Nakamoto Block Chain Algorithm  
15:23 <cjd> I've gone over a whole bunch of different names and I'm feeling like I like   `CoinPad` or `ChainPad`  
15:24 <cjd> CoinPad has only 14000 results on google (very important that we can make it to the top of a google search)  
15:24 <cjd> ChainPad has 30k results which is a bit more because it is something about jewlery  
15:26 <vmassol> :)  
15:26 <cjd> Other thoughts included CollabChain (too many sylabils) and EditSync (same)  
15:27 <cjd> I really want to justify CoinPad but I want to make sure people are not going to associate it with money  
15:28 <cjd> ...which they probably will  
15:31 <KermitTheFragger> has quit  
15:35 <cjd> HashPad  
15:35 <cjd> 2,920 very good  
15:39 <evalica> has quit  
15:48 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
15:52 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
16:08 <sdumitriu\_[Away]> is now known as <sdumitriu>  
16:10 <vmassol> mflorea: didn't I close this issue laready?  
16:10 <vmassol> XWIki-10019  
16:10 <vmassol> ah 6.1M1  
16:10 <vmassol> I guess I missed something  
16:10 <mflorea> yes, see comment on github  
16:11 <mflorea> on your previous commit  
16:11 <vmassol> that was causing some test to fail?  
16:11 <mflorea> no, I just discovered by chance..  
16:11 <vmassol> ok, thanks (i don't understand the issue yet, but thanks for fixing whatever was needed :))  
16:11 <mflorea> np :)  
16:12 <vmassol> oh  
16:12 <vmassol> I reported an issue recently  
16:12 <vmassol> about the auto conversion not working anymore  
16:12 <vmassol> syntax conversion  
16:12 <mflorea> I didn't see it  
16:12 <mflorea> we need to close it  
16:12 <vmassol> let me check if I creatd a jira for it  
16:13 <mflorea> probably not, because I don't remember seeing it  
16:13 <vmassol> I'm sure I reported here but I'm not sure I created a jira  
16:13 <vmassol> I disocvered it with GD on Wednesday 2 weeks ago  
16:14 <vmassol> 26th of feb  
16:15 <vmassol> http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/IRC/xwikiArchive20140226  
16:15 <vmassol> 15:41  
16:15 <vmassol> I said I could reproduce on 5.4.x  
16:15 <vmassol> ah no  
16:15 <vmassol> I said "if"  
16:15 <vmassol> sorry  
16:15 <vmassol> :)  
16:15 <vmassol> too bad, I guess I forgot to create the jira issue  
16:16 <mflorea> iit shouldn't affect 5.4.x, just 6.0  
16:16 <vmassol> yes  
16:16 <mflorea> which should be fine now  
16:16 <vmassol> pfew  
16:16 <vmassol> thanks for saving me!  
16:16 <mflorea> :)  
16:16 <mflorea> you're welcome  
16:20 <vmassol> jenkins is extra fast now, pretty cool :)  
16:20 <vmassol> (the UI)  
16:22 <cjd> https://github.com/cjdelisle/cjdrt -- pretty sure I'll use ChainPad, here's a preview of the new documentation for the algorithm  
16:23 <cjd> need to talk to Fabio first and then I'll propose moving it to contrib  
16:36 <vmassol> cool  
16:36 <silverdrop> has quit  
16:47 <juannicolas> has joined #xwiki  
16:47 <juannicolas> hello again.  
16:48 <juannicolas> wondering, how could I send new user email with password in? at least sent it in the confirmation email.  
16:53 <Inge-> send password in mail O\_o  
16:54 <juannicolas> hold on..  
17:00 <ClemensR> I think XWiki only stores the encrypted value, so all you can do is send that one ... which is not really helpful  
17:01 <cjd> you could change the password to a temporary randomly generated password, send it to them and ask them to login and change it  
17:01 <vmassol> why send a password though?  
17:02 <cjd> because it was in the question :)   indeed a broader question might lead to a more simple solution  
17:02 <juannicolas> ok, here is the thing. I just configured a new user and he did receive the validate your account email.  
17:03 <juannicolas> But when the user clicks the link to activate the account, the link takes the new user to the login page of the wiki. But, how the user could login if he/she don't have the password for the account in order to activate it?  
17:04 <juannicolas> maybe I'm missing something.  
17:04 <juannicolas> got: USER EMAIL VERIFICATION: YES and AUTHENTICATION ACTIVE CHECK: no  
17:05 <OSIMasson> has quit  
17:15 <ClemensR> ah, the validation page is not public, that is the problem  
17:16 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
17:17 <ClemensR> you cannot run that invitation thing if anonymous users are not allowed to view any pages in the wiki - they need to be able to view the confirmation page at least  
17:20 <juannicolas> and what page would be that one in the default pages created by de wizard?  
17:21 <juannicolas> give me a minute, I will try to figure this out by my self.  
17:27 <juannicolas> ClemensR: you were right. I by mistake close access to guest to the XWiki Space where is actually the page for the activation process. /xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/AccountValidation?validkey  
17:27 <vmassol> has quit  
17:28 <ClemensR> ah, there it is :) (I forgot where ....)  Actually it does not look like such a bad idea to close the XWiki space to public, but unfortunately it sometimes it is  
17:30 <OSIMasson> has joined #xwiki  
17:30 <juannicolas> good, now that was resolved. So, how can i send the password of the account in the confirmation email? What if i don't have direct communication with the user i'm creating, and the confirmation email only gives the username but not the password.  
17:57 <juannicolas> btw just to add to the topic before, I checked this option: "Prevent unregistered users from viewing pages, regardless of the page or space rights" and that's why the user could not see the Activation Page.
